definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: Tears don't mean you're losing, everybody's bruising.
sentences.chinese: 眼泪并不意味着你失去了，大家的青肿。

sentences.english: Repeated hitting raised a large bruise.
sentences.chinese: 反复击打造成一大块青肿。

sentences.english: She held her head high as a small trickle of blood ran down from her bruised knee.
sentences.chinese: 她高高扬起头，青肿的膝盖上一滴血慢慢流下来。

sentences.english: We saw his lips were puffed both eyes were discolored. His face discolored and swollen.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见他嘴唇肿起，两眼充血，脸庞青肿。

sentences.english: A: Right here, it's badly bruised and swollen.
sentences.chinese: 就在这里，青肿得很厉害。

sentences.english: The thief got away, but not without some scratches and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 小偷带着浑身的抓痕和青肿逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: When he finishes, her face is still lopsided and slightly bruised.
sentences.chinese: 手术结束时，她的面部仍然歪向一边，且有些青肿。

sentences.english: She got huge bruises on each side of her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她腰的两侧，都已经青肿得不成样子。

sentences.english: Right here. It's badly bruised and swollen.
sentences.chinese: 就在这里，青肿得很厉害。

sentences.english: A bit of embrocation will soothe your bruised knee.
sentences.chinese: 用一点搽剂可使你那青肿的膝部消肿。

sentences.english: With dirty faces, banged up chins.
sentences.chinese: 有脏兮兮的小脸，和撞得青肿的下巴。

sentences.english: With this disease the patient bruises easily.
sentences.chinese: 因这种疾病，病人身上很容易出现青肿。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
a black eye (idiom); serious injury to the face/fig. a setback/a defeat
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
